content.raw: After opening the file in the line below, this will always return true; whether or not the file existed before that call. This saves the value before opening.
content.html: After opening the file in the line below, this will always return true; whether or not the file existed before that call. This saves the value before opening.

content.raw: In this case, I am checking to see if train, any step, was the task specified by the user. This could probably be renamed especially since it does clash with the cases where train is actually running, but I’m at a loss for a better term. Maybe train.selected?
content.html: In this case, I am checking to see if train, any step, was the task specified by the user. This could probably be renamed especially since it does clash with the cases where train is actually running, but I’m at a loss for a better term. Maybe train.selected?

update.description:
* Removed all subdir creation from train\_run
* Train\_run loads options from train.tab
* Add function to load windows from bed file
* Import Window class from util
* Train has been split
* Added train steps test case
* Produce input.master for each train instance in init
* Save and reload the identify options
* Save train\_results files to their own directories
* revert function parse\_options back to pre steps code. Change was accidental
* Fixed saving bug in results file where it doubled the work dirname
* Used identify.tab to pass options between steps and prevent train.tab from overwriting
* Added identify steps test case
* Changed parse\_options to only allow the correct options to be applied to each of the steps and added train-run-round
* Broke parse\_options function
* Fixed fromoptions in cases where the options were not compatible with the step given
* Updated simpleidentifysteps test case for new command line changes
* Updated all test cases to match new command line order
* fixed touchstone for simpleconcat
* Revisions to step seperation code
* Remove resolution from identify
* Fix test cases for resolution changes
* Added train-run-round functionality to recover\_train\_instance
* some how got rid of tri file creation
* Updated train.tab files for new train options
* Checked for specific errno instead of just 2
* Changed dockerfile to hoffmanlab one in pipeline
* removed new line in \_util imports
* fixed configparser imports
* Python 3 revision performed in the wrong branch
* Fixed argument order in command line
* Fixed functionaliy of cmdline
* Fixed track\_indexes in task.py
* Updated test cases for different cmdline order
* Fixed docker image in pipeline
* added setup.py from default segway
* Fix run.sh for simpleidentifysteps
* Took task.py from default Segway branch
* Changed touchstone for train and identify steps for task.py changes
* Fixed layer issue caused by mistakenly removed rsplit
* Match online repo
* Fixed issue where Ordereddict wasn't being read in order
* Fixed job log headers
* used python to call compare directory in simple train steps
* used python to call compare directory in simple train steps
* Added run-round with multiple instances test
* fixed run.sh for indetify steps
update.title: Split Segway Tasks into Steps

content.raw: The words were changed to be in alphabetical order for consistency between different running methods. This means visibility is now last and has the “/n” character attached which is stripped here.
content.html: The words were changed to be in alphabetical order for consistency between different running methods. This means visibility is now last and has the “/n” character attached which is stripped here.

content.raw:
@mjmm13 this is ready for your revision.

A few big points since this will have to go through another revision:

* Make sure you run your code through a linter like `flake8` or `Pylint` before resubmission.
* More generous comments and docstrings would be _very_ appreciated. There are some significant changes here that are not-so-obvious to me.
* If it all possible, remove the asserts and replace with an actual realistic error message. At the very least comment as to what the assertion is supposed to catch.
content.html:
@mjmm13 this is ready for your revision.

A few big points since this will have to go through another revision:

  • Make sure you run your code through a linter like flake8 or Pylint before resubmission.
  • More generous comments and docstrings would be very appreciated. There are some significant changes here that are not-so-obvious to me.
  • If it all possible, remove the asserts and replace with an actual realistic error message. At the very least comment as to what the assertion is supposed to catch.

content.raw: With this PR does the "verb" \(train, train-init, identify\) now have to come immediately after the `segway` command? How come `$cluster_arg` can come before? If not why are the arguments re-arranged?
content.html: With this PR does the "verb" (train, train-init, identify) now have to come immediately after the segway command? How come $cluster_arg can come before? If not why are the arguments re-arranged?

content.raw:
Could just place all the below inside an if statement containing both negated versions of the conditions above.

e.g.

```python
if value and
   not (name in IDENTIFY_OPTION_TYPES.keys and (self.identify.running() or self.posterior.running())):
   # logic below this
```

Maybe place the conditional logic into a boolean variable to help readability like `is_training_option` for the equivalent 2nd conditional
